key_channel_insights.line_content: The MSE channel demonstrates a high degree of price parity with Finnair's website, with prices matching 63.8% of the time.
When discrepancies occur, OTAs generally list fares higher by an average of 0.44% compared to Finnair's website.
GDS listings often display elevated prices, with 47% of itineraries showing higher rates than Finnair's website.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: The OTA channel does not show offers found on the airline's website in over 50% of cases assessed.
Where discrepancies exist, the OTA typically lists higher prices, with an overall average price increase of 0.44% versus the airline's direct site.
Price discrepancies have remained consistent over the past month, with no significant fluctuation in overall OTA pricing trends.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: In the latest week, over 52% of the offers available on Finnair's website are not presented on OTA channels, remaining consistent compared to the previous month.
In instances where prices differ, OTA pricing is consistently higher than the airline’s site by an average of 0.44%.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul flights experience significant non-availability on OTAs, missing over 54% of the airline's offers.
Long haul flights show a 9.52% decrease in OTA listings compared to the previous month, yet all are priced higher.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For flights originating from Finland, 67.97% of offers are not found on OTAs, maintaining consistent unavailability.
Almost all offers from non-Finland origins found on OTAs are priced higher than on the airline's website.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For close-in bookings, 49% of the airline's offers are not found on OTAs, with the remainder priced at a 0.38% premium.
Far-out bookings show higher OTA unavailability by 56% with those listed bearing a 0.54% price increase.

mse_highlights.line_content: Across all dimensions, prices on MSE are identical to Finnair’s site 63.8% of the time, indicating strong price alignment with the airline's own channel.
In 32.9% of cases, MSE offers lower prices than the Finnair website. This represents a significant opportunity to shift demand to the airline's direct channels.
Only 2.97% of the time, prices are higher on MSE, suggesting limited risk of losing price competitiveness through the channel.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Instances where offers are missing from MSE dropped by 18% week-over-week. This could reflect improved listing consistency.
Instances of identical pricing remained stable with a small week-over-week rise of 9.23%, indicating little volatility in price matching.
Cases where MSE offered lower prices decreased by 9.80% from the previous week, suggesting potential alignment measures are taking effect.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul flights showed a 64.9% rate of price parity, revealing a balanced approach in this segment.
For long-haul, 65% of the fares are lower on MSE compared to Finnair’s site, indicating pressure points in this segment.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Flights originating from Finland show 78.97% price parity, which is the highest across all origin regions.
Non-Finnish origins predominantly exhibit lower prices on MSE, with an occurrence rate of 79.69%, indicating a strategic alignment opportunity.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings have 59.42% price parity, but 36.10% are lower on MSE, suggesting potential to capture last-minute demand.
For far-out bookings, 69.64% maintain price parity, affirming controlled pricing strategies over extended booking horizons.

gds_highlights.line_content: GDS channel not listing the same offers as the Finnair website for over 52% of routes last week.
The GDS channel often has higher prices than Finnair's website, with 47% of all analyzed itineraries showing this trend.
Only a negligible portion of itineraries show the same prices across both GDS and Finnair's website, reflecting the disparate pricing strategies.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Over half of the itineraries had no equivalent offer on the GDS channel compared to Finnair's site, showing a gap in GDS presence.
47% of prices are higher on the GDS compared to Finnair's website, highlighting a consistent trend of elevated prices via this channel.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul routes show a 54% rate of GDS not matching website listings, with 45% having higher GDS prices.
Long haul routes consistently exhibit higher GDS prices, at a full 100% occurrence for all tested scenarios.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Flights originating from FI reflected a significant GDS absence in 68% of observations, while 31% showed higher GDS prices.
Non-Finnish points of origin have near-universal higher GDS prices at 98%, indicating a pricing inconsistency with Finnair's own site.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings exhibit nearly half of the itineraries priced higher on GDS, with minimal same-price occurrences.
Far-out bookings see over 56% of routes with GDS offers not available, and among listed offers, 43% showed higher GDS pricing.
